title: Center of mass - system of three cars on a bridge

content.question: Three cars are at rest on a <math alttext="50" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>50</mn></math> meter long bridge. Car <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math>, with mass <math alttext="1,000 kilograms" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>000</mn><mspace width="0.15em"></mspace><mi>kg</mi></math>, is <math alttext="5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>5</mn></math> meters from the left end of the bridge; Car <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math>, with mass <math alttext="500 kilograms" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>500</mn><mspace width="0.15em"></mspace><mi>kg</mi></math>, is <math alttext="20" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>20</mn></math> meters from the left end of the bridge; and Car <math alttext="C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>C</mtext></math>, with mass <math alttext="2,000 kilograms" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>000</mn><mspace width="0.15em"></mspace><mi>kg</mi></math>, is <math alttext="45" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>45</mn></math> meters from the left end of the bridge. How far from the left end of the bridge is the center of mass of the three-car system located?

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
